Review: ¬†It was my son's bday and the staff left cakes and balloons in the room, a lovely gesture that made his weekend - so very kind of the front of house staff to organise this. I too was upgraded for a discounted rate. It's a shame London is fairly quiet during Covid but it's a good time now to sightsee, shop etc - as it's a bit calmer.  Loads of shops and places to eat only mins from hotel. You're kind of 10 mins in a cab from everywhere - covent garden etc. Defo recommend this hotel, we will be back 100%. The parking too was a great addition also, so not carrying of bags across London. The staff are a credit to the hotel, and it was always cleaned and the staff ensured those staying adhered to rules (i.e. masks). Great hotel!!! Great Staff!! Great Location!!
Title: Staff are awesome! Just a great spacious hotel! Very clean! Great location!

Review:
¬†I loved the service from the reception, to housekeeping, to dining room staff, to the Operations Manager and last but not the least The General Manager who was always on the floor assisting the guest as well as her staff and setting an excellent example.
With all the obstacles the staff faced during this pandemic, they made sure I was extremely comfortable and happy at every turn.
I  must honestly say that they didn't leave a single stone unturned to make my stay a memorable one as well as to confirm my return.
Title: I booked this hotel by accident but will always come back when I am in London.

Review: ¬†The staff was very welcoming, helpful and really polite. I can't remember all the names but certainly Ana Maria and a gentleman who was on a shift with her. They made special effort for my mom's birthday, managed to get us a top floor apartment!!! Gave me useful tips, kept us informed and made sure our stay was smooth. I loved the facilities, rooms and location more than anything. You can walk to any central London destination. The breakfast was also pretty impressive.

Review:
¬†Location excellent. We were meeting family in a couple of of nearby venues in the Victoria area so it was a perfect location for this. In fact I would go as far as to say its pretty much the perfect location for all of the Victoria night spots as all seemed to be just a short walk away.
Hotel staff very friendly. They couldn't do enough for us, so a big thank you for this. The Executive Double Room that we had was of a very good size and plenty of room for two people. Room was exceptionally clean as indeed was the bathroom.
Covid-19 precautions all there as you would expect, so always felt very safe and comfortable at the Park Plaza Victoria.
Would definitely stay there again.
Title: A perfect stay in a perfect location

Review:
¬†Friendly staff. Hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Victoria Station and you can enjoy the many shops and eateries on Wilton Road. Modern spacious rooms with air conditioning, electric curtains, comfortable bed and nice bathroom. 
Breakfast cost an additional ¬£10 but is well worth it, due to COVID-19 the breakfast is placed in a paper bag which you collect from the hotel bar at a specified time. You can relax in the bar area which is very modern and comfortable, you also have free refills of coffee from the machine. To summarise this Hotel will exceed your expectations.
Title: Excellent Hotel.

¬†Our second stay and definitely hotel of choice when staying over in London; staff are exceptional and nothing is too much trouble, smiles and first class service at all times. 
Upgraded our stay to the most amazing suite that‚Äôs larger than our apartment at home; amazing terraces, we‚Äôll return :-)

Review: ¬†The new set up to deal with covid was excellent
Title: Wonderful

Review: ¬†The hotel was lovely and so easy to get to from Victoria underground. Immediately could see the hotel had been very careful to make everything clean and safe. On check in the lady on the desk was very helpful and made us feel welcome. Room was great, with modern control pad and the comfiest bed. Delivered breakfast packs to us in the morning which were delicious including bacon and egg roll and fresh fruit and pastries! After checkout they kept our bags for us so we could explore all day. Will definitely be coming back!
Title: Wonderful stay!

Review: ¬†The staff were helpful with the receptionist changing my room for one with a better view. They did bring up our breakfast to our room and interacted with us regularly and gave us plates to eat the food we brought in. You could tell they were trying their best under trying circumstances. The front door is locked after 5pm which i suppose adds some reassurances.

¬†Pleasant stay. 
Need to order housekeeping now, but could locate a time which was good.
Title: Very Good

Review:
¬†Great location for Victoria, ninety seconds walk and close to a few great bars/restaurants as well.
Staff were amazing, friendly, professional and nothing was too much trouble.
Reception area is ultra modern and clean lines but rooms are a little dated in comparison, lighting is digital but poor; bathrooms are very dated with a bath and old style shower. That said, everything is spotlessly clean and we enjoyed our stay.
Title: Great location and good for an overnight in London.

Review: ¬†Everything was fantastic, we were given an exceptional welcome and service, from the checking in to our room. The staff are excellent and we dealt with manager Ahmed, and Francesca, who went above and beyond to provide us a great service and stay. I understand the current situation isn't great for everyone and certain services aren't available but the staff can only do as much as they're capable of. With all this taken into consideration and the location was great for commuting around london, I and the wife were very pleased to have stayed with Park Plaza Victoria London.
Title: Park Plaza Victoria London stay.

The rooms are nice and well equipped, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the bar area is welcoming and nicely decorated. We didn't go to the restaurant (Tozi) this time as we had other plans but it is definitely worth trying out as it was great last time!

Review:
¬†the location is great! walking distance to Buckingham palace, just 5min, about 20min to Westminster and additional 5 to cross the bridge to London Eye. Metro station is 200m from the hotel, station is Victoria which is connected to all lines and plus train station of course. 
Rooms are very well maintained, very helpful staff. 
The breakfast was all days exactly the same and rather poor. to add some differences - you have to pay 5pounds, for kids you may order pancakes or waffles complimentary from the chief...
Title: good value for money! very good location!

Review: ¬†A properly run, big hotel at small hotel prices. In the centre of things; restaurants, bars, coffee shops, malls, tube station etc... just minutes away. Modern, well-equipped, clean rooms - great bed too! Professional staff with a very accommodating outlook towards guests' needs. Overall, probably the best value for money hotel I've ever stayed at in London. Will 100% stay again.

Review: ¬†Location was perfect, two minutes to Victoria Station with all the public transportation right there.  Room was very clean, although the bathtub shower combination was awkward to use.  The staff was superb.  Francesca was very sweet and accommodating.  We arrived several hours before we could check in, and they stored our luggage while we did some sightseeing.  Breakfast was very good, albeit pricey.  We ate the only one time, since there were plenty of other place we wanted to try.  Very nice Italian restaurant, Tozi on premises.  Could not ask for better location.
Title: Could not ask for better location, so close to transportation, withing walking distance to Hyde Park

Review:
¬†We stayed at the Park Plaza during a two night stopover in London en route from Budapest to Orlando. The location is a five minute walk from the Gatwick Express and very convenient if you have an early morning flight departure. You can get anywhere in London via tube from Victoria and there is a bus stop right outside the hotel; we took the number 24 bus to Trafalgar Square and enjoyed sightseeing from the upper deck. 
The room was fairly large and comfortable. The shampoo, conditioner and bath lotion were of good quality and the hotel provided a proper hair dryer (not the awful wall dryers) and an iron and ironing board.
We didn't eat in the hotel although the restaurant and bar area looked nice. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and pubs around the hotel.
Title: Modern hotel walking distance to Victoria Station

Review:
¬†Booked into the hotel in a polite and professional manner, yes you do expect this but its not always what you receive so a thank you on that note. 
When I mentioned it was a surprise booking for my wife's birthday and family plus we would eating in Tozi I though no more of it but the gentleman booking me said he would let them know what the occasion was, most appreciated.
What I did not expect when I returned with my wife was a bottle of champagne and a lovely selection of chocolates and fruits on a slate platter wishing my wife a happy birthday along with a card. So to the front office team and Guest Relation Manager Ara you made a special day even better. Thanks guys and girls :)
As for the hotel in general, lovely contemporary style with a great lounge area you can spend some time lounging around in, ideal wind down area after a night out.
Rooms were clean and tidy, bed was amazingly comfortable and considering the traffic quiet as well, what more can you ask. 
If I am staying in in town again, I will be booking here.
Title: An unexpected treat

What I did not expect when I returned with my wife was a bottle of champagne and a lovely selection of chocolates and fruits on a slate platter wishing my wife a happy birthday along with a card. So to the front office team and Guest Relation Manager Ara you made a special day even better. Thanks guys and girls :)
As for the hotel in general, lovely contemporary style with a great lounge area you can spend some time lounging around in, ideal wind down area after a night out.
Rooms were clean and tidy, bed was amazingly comfortable and considering the traffic quiet as well, what more can you ask. 
If I am staying in in town again, I will be booking here.

Review:
¬†The location is great for a short walk to Victoria tube, railway, and coach station. There are also local services and we had  lunch in a nearby pub (The Brougham), which was great.
We were on the 6th floor in a "superior" double room, which offered a view across Westminster and The Shard. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quite spacious for central London. Nice big screen TV in the room too.
Breakfast selection was very good with a choice of full English or continental. However, the second day, the sausages could have been better (gristle and bone in them).
Title: Short break in the capital

Review:
¬†The location is great for a short walk to Victoria tube, railway, and coach station. There are also local services and we had  lunch in a nearby pub (The Brougham), which was great.
We were on the 6th floor in a "superior" double room, which offered a view across Westminster and The Shard. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quite spacious for central London. Nice big screen TV in the room too.
Breakfast selection was very good with a choice of full English or continental. However, the second day, the sausages could have been better (gristle and bone in them).
Title: Short break in the capital

Review:
¬†Great location - a short walk to Victoria underground so very easy to get around London.
A few great restaurants right across the street - very handy for a quick breakfast.
We arrived back late from a show at Victoria Palace Theatre and were able to get room service at 11:30pm.  Very efficient service.  The room was a really good size with the queen size bed and queen size pullout - perfect for our family of 4.
Title: Wonderful

Thanks

In all a very good visit to London and we would stay at this hotel again.

Review: ¬†The room  was reasonably large, had good wifi, good lighting and clean.  The Staff were particularly helpful and  friendly.  The Concierge  was wonderful.  They helped us  many times during our two night stay.  What stands out to us is the bar service.  We had light meals and wine in the evening and found the food in the bar to be quite good.  Both times we were served by a young lady from Bulgaria that remembered our choices from the previous night and provided exceptional friendly service.  We already have decided to return to this hotel in a few weeks.
Title: Nice place with good service

Review: ¬†We didn't really use the hotel facilities - just for sleeping.  Our room was really comfortable, clean and fairly quiet.  Window could be opened. This hotel is an excellent base for London sightseeing, just a few minutes walk from Victoria tube station.

Lots of buttons in a control panel for lighting, air, etc.  Plenty of lifts, which were pretty fast.  This hotel is an excellent base for London sightseeing, just a few minutes walk from Victoria tube station.
Title: Comfortable, clean, great location - we will go back.  I'd just appreciate a warmer welcome.

Review:
¬†This hotel was in viewing distance of the wicked show so it was ideal. Room was spotless, got a large bed instead of the twin beds but was with my 7 year old so we didn‚Äôt care enough to tell reception. Games on tv and sky so was good to relax after touring London, close to tube and bus tours. 
Staff were fantastic couldn‚Äôt do enough for my daughter, she loved the hot choc the gentleman got her to have with her breakfast very nice touch.  
Breakfasts was nice plenty of choice, maybe alittle over cooked for me, but still nice but eggs were lovely! Perfect gem in a busy city. My daughter said it was the poshest place she has ever been (she has been to a Hilton) and this is how all her holidays should be! Bit of a shock with camping next month!
Title: Amazing location for Wicked, outstanding staff

¬†Staff were very good. We were at a family event. Unfortunately some of the negotiations were not fully met but all in all very good service during our stay.

I highlighted this with your staff but was not offered any form of discount or voucher for a future stay.
Title: Your Staff made our visit good and they were very welcoming. The food above average and reasonable.

Review: ¬†I loved the fact that my spacious room was operated by a control panel. The bed was huge and very comfortable. Variety of pillows was provided too.  Good mini bar and tea/coffee facilities with free bottled water. The bathroom was very clean and bright with good brand tolietires, however the hand soap was missing. I was very pleased I got exactly what I asked for: top floor room with a city view. The location of the hotel is brilliant, not only very close to the Victoria train station and tube but also a walking distance to the central London if you would like to avoid crowded underground.
Title: I am never disappointed by Park Plaza.

Good mini bar and tea/coffee facilities with free bottled water. The bathroom was very clean and bright with good brand tolietires, however the hand soap was missing. I was very pleased I got exactly what I asked for: top floor room with a city view. The location of the hotel is brilliant, not only very close to the Victoria train station and tube but also a walking distance to the central London if you would like to avoid crowded underground.
Title: I am never disappointed by Park Plaza.

Title: Met expectation.

Review: ¬†Bed extremely comfy.
Title: Met expectation.

Review: ¬†The room was absolutely lovely. The bed was very comfortable. The TV was great with helpful tourist info. The electronic keypad to control the lights, curtains and room service was absolute luxury once we got to grips with it. The bathroom was beautiful with two showers. The staff were helpful and attentive. The gym was very good. The bar was comfortable and the barman was great. Perfect balance between helpful and giving us space to relax. The doorman helped us with our luggage on arrival. Breakfast was great and the staff were polite and helpful. The location is perfect. So near lots of great tourist spots and next to a major rail station. Good restaurants nearby. Upon leaving, the staff had no problem letting us leave our luggage until our late evening flight even though we checked out in the morning.
Title: Great hotel. Very much recommended.

Review: ¬†Very close to Victoria train station esp if you ignore the google map directions and ask a member of staff at the station - even so on google hotel is under 10 mins from train station. Check in was good esp so that we had a free upgrade, the room was excellent! Spacious, adjustable lighting, electric curtains, A/C etc all controlled from bedside and wall consoles. Nice bathroom!

Review: ¬†Central location, comfy bed, nice view, breakfast was nice but would have preferred the buffet, it wasn‚Äôt there because of COVID but the main reason I booked the hotel was because of how good the buffet looked so when I found my only option as a vegetarian was porridge and pastry and fruit and cereal I was quite annoyed. They ended up giving me a meat breakfast no meat and all that was was an egg hash brown and spinach so I‚Äôm very disssapointed. It would be nice if different dietary needs were taken into consideration and treated more equally, for example veggie bacon or veggie sausage. I do not understand why porridge is deemed as an appropriate alternative to a fry up.
Title: Good

Review: ¬†The hotel is in a great location, within a short walking distance of Victoria Station (take the Wilton Road exit). It is easy to catch the underground from Heathrow, changing at Hammersmith (just cross the platform for the Circle Line there) with relatively few steps to negotiate with luggage at Victoria. You can walk to Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abby, Houses of Parliament, Whitehall etc, and catch tube connections to other destinations in London. There is a nice lobby in the hotel and it is in a quiet location, with comfortable rooms. There are shops (even a large Sainsburies) and restaurants close by. The Italian themed restaurant in the hotel is first class, and we thought that the room service was good quality. Overall we enjoyed the experience. It is pricey, but that is London.
Title: Great location and fundamentally good, but some shortcomings

Review: ¬†One bedroom apartment with balcony was blocked for us over the phone due to available for our days of stay. On arrival we have been told by receptionist Ana-Maria that it's not available due to other guest who stayed in the hotel through loyalty programme wanted to stay extra night. We were suggested to pay extra and stay in 2 bedroom apartment instead. I did say that we have payed already for one bedroom apartment so it should be one available at least without view (must admit we have booked this hotel based on conversation over the phone that this type of appartment is available for our stay). We have been offered to switch the apartment next day if this guest will leave. We have done this, but the room had no balcony as the one that we stayed the night before, so I believe receptionist had herself confused as to which appartments have balconies and which not. General experience of the hotel was good, staff are very nice and polite, clean rooms, comfortable beds, apartments are good for family to stay, car park is a bit pricey ¬£30p/n., but this hotel had one so we have used it, good location. London eye and Buckingham palace within walking distance, Sainsbury's shop nearby. Good bars and restaurants nearby.
Title: Very Good

General experience of the hotel was good, staff are very nice and polite, clean rooms, comfortable beds, apartments are good for family to stay, car park is a bit pricey ¬£30p/n., but this hotel had one so we have used it, good location. London eye and Buckingham palace within walking distance, Sainsbury's shop nearby. Good bars and restaurants nearby.

Review: ¬†I have stayed here several times pre covid and really enjoyed it.On this occasion they were very covid compliant checking our temperature and providing santisers but the hotel did not have that buzz i am used to,which i supposed can be said of many locations in london.i was disappointed with the very limited food menu which you had to eat in your room. The breakfast menu was dire and i wished i ate out instead.Room service is on request only and as we only stayed for two nights we didnt bother. I will stay here again once covid subsides.

¬†Due to covid we had to get a packed up breakfast which meant lots of packaging in the bedroom. Also due to covid the housekeeping staff aren't coming in to the room each day. Under the sofa bed hasn't been cleaned in some time and there's dust and litter.

Review: ¬†Breakfast was just okay for me.  Scrambled eggs were awful.  Room- always rather warm.  Had to sleep with window open and shut it when noise became an issue.  Toilet never did flush normally.  Had to flush handle like 10 to 20 times for it to finally flush.  Told front desk 3 days in a row, but if they ever sent someone to work on it, I wouldn't know.  We were out all day.  Gave up after 3 days of asking and just dealt with it for the other 4 nights.  Others in our family group said they had no issues with theirs.
Title: Would definitely stay here again!

Review: ¬†Was quite pricey...but it was also luxurious.  Not keen on the atmosphere in the cocktail bar - the big screens & the huge kids play area.  That seems to have been installed since we were last there & there was a kids party with screeching toddlers! ...But I guess they had fun, and it‚Äôs understandable if they want to make the hotel a bit more kid friendly... would be nice to have a cordoned off more intimate area as the room was very large with high ceilings.  Maybe only one screen near the kids play area - the other one is not necessary!

Review:
¬†Not a big thing but still I would like to mention... I ordered a cappuccino and according to the price list this was ¬£3.50. I then got the cheque for ¬£4.5 and when I queried this the staff said that they brought me a large coffee however i was never asked if I want a large one and also there were no different sizes on offer in the list. I did of course paid the ¬£4.5. And it‚Äôs not about the amount it‚Äôs about the principal. 
The stay was excellent other than the fact that the cleaners did not clean the fridge and there was left over food from previous occupants so when I opened the fridge the smell was so horrible that I felt sick. It was difficult to get rid of the smell. They did act though immediately which was good but still the smell was there..

Review:
¬†The bathroom does not have its own separate switch so you must walk to the master control at the door to turn on the bathroom light.  Ridiculous!! The shower is flush to the floor so naturally leaks all over the floor when you use it.  
The restaurant served smal plate dinners and was very delicious. Very difficult to get a reservation- even as a guest at the hotel--ridiculous!!.  The hotel needs more restaurant options on the premise for the amount of people staying at the hotel. The lobby is non-existent so offering a  comfortable or accommodating setting to wait for taxis or meet people.  The location is fine- a good walk to all points of interest and not a particularly attractive area. Good if your connecting out of Victoria station.  Concierge service limited at best.
Title: Good

Review:
¬†The bathroom does not have its own separate switch so you must walk to the master control at the door to turn on the bathroom light.  Ridiculous!! The shower is flush to the floor so naturally leaks all over the floor when you use it.  
The restaurant served smal plate dinners and was very delicious. Very difficult to get a reservation- even as a guest at the hotel--ridiculous!!.  The hotel needs more restaurant options on the premise for the amount of people staying at the hotel. The lobby is non-existent so offering a  comfortable or accommodating setting to wait for taxis or meet people.  The location is fine- a good walk to all points of interest and not a particularly attractive area. Good if your connecting out of Victoria station.  Concierge service limited at best.

Review:
¬†We were invited to request a room upgrade online before our stay and so I requested an upgrade. However, on arrival, the lady on the concierge told us there was no such request on their system! Strange since I had email confirmation to remind them on arrival! We were offered a different room upgrade to what we had requested that didn't suit so we declined. The reception on checking-in was less than friendly - almost clinical! However, checking-out and porter staff were excellent.
The bathroom in our room was looking tired - a cracked floor tile and mastic around the bath heavily peeling away with a small amount of mould staining. We always prefer a shower cubicle nowadays but it was an awkward shower contraption over the bath - certainly would be awkward for less agile people. This was the only thing that let down our otherwise nice room.
Title: Short break in the capital

Review:
¬†View from the window - as often typical for London hotels - was less than attractive, though quite possibly not the property of this hotel. Somebody should get rid of the rubbish though, but not particularly visible to us on the 7th floor. 
What the hotel does own is its car park, and access to this is via a lift - yes a car lift (capacity 4000 kg) which is so narrow that the parking sensors would not stop. The car park itself is just a hotel basement, and not designed for the view of guests - so an attempt should be made to tidy it up.
Title: hotel chosen for location and amenities and by and large did not disappoint

Review:
¬†Dinner restaurant - would like it to have a regular menu. We had several days where we were so tired we didn't want to go out and had to settle for room service or bar food.
Bathroom has issues - the shower door is not engineered properly to prevent water from pouring out on floor - we had to use bath mat and one huge towel to prevent water from running out onto entry carpet.
Lighting - room is TOO DARK - the entry and closet areas are so dark we couldn't see to deal with clothing in the closet. Room itself needs brighter light - we were trying to read documents and had a great deal of trouble.
Room chair - can the weird quasi-recliner and put in a comfortable chair or love seat.
Storage for clothing - there is no dresser or cabinet with shelves other than one shelf in the closet, which is so dark you can't see to put up and get out clothes without a flashlight!
Title: A great place to stay that needs to tweak some room related things.

Ask at reception where we could get a nice steak close by and we were given no recommendations, after eating else where we went back to the hotel to find they have steak on there menu which‚Äôs suggests to me that 1 they either don‚Äôt rate there own food or 2 they are oblivious to what food they serve
Hotel was under construction which meant most of the lobby was closed off
The light were not working properly in the bar area - constantly flashing and changing colors- we heard the waitress regularly apologizing saying the person who looked after it was off till Monday 
The price of food and drink in this hotel is borderline offensive- just because you are an expensive hotel trying to attract a certain type of clientele doesn‚Äôt mean you can rob your customers.
Title: Disappointing for the money spent

Review: ¬†The ‚Äòexecutive‚Äô room was a disappointment... we were 3 ladies and expected 3 nice beds not one sofa with very thin mattress... also, room was only fitted out for 2 people, had to ask for gown & slippers and towels for 3rd person. Fridge was dirty with congealed milk on the bottom ... yuk! The only reason this could be called executive was because it had desk... for the price it was not even as good as a normal twin/double room which I have stayed in twice before.the main disappointment was the fact that the beautiful lounge bar in the ground floor was out of use... we should have been told about this as this was one of the main reasons we chose to come back to hotel.. it was my daughters 40th birthday celebration, there were 7 of us staying and we were looking forward to a relaxing time in the very spacious and beautiful surroundings... the ‚Äòexecutive‚Äô lounge was no comparison. Also, I informed you when I booked it was her 40th but no acknowledgement of this whatsoever from hotel... very disappointing.
Title: Disappointing and not up to standard expected... not  being told about lounge  bar is unnaceptable

The only reason this could be called executive was because it had desk... for the price it was not even as good as a normal twin/double room which I have stayed in twice before.the main disappointment was the fact that the beautiful lounge bar in the ground floor was out of use... we should have been told about this as this was one of the main reasons we chose to come back to hotel.. it was my daughters 40th birthday celebration, there were 7 of us staying and we were looking forward to a relaxing time in the very spacious and beautiful surroundings... the ‚Äòexecutive‚Äô lounge was no comparison. Also, I informed you when I booked it was her 40th but no acknowledgement of this whatsoever from hotel... very disappointing.
Title: Disappointing and not up to standard expected... not  being told about lounge  bar is unnaceptable

Review: ¬†From the moment we checked in, we had problems with the flush in our toilet.  They said they fixed it after we called, but it never worked correctly during our entire stay.  We found the bathtub/shower to be very dangerous.  It was extremely slick when wet and not enough grab bars and we had to call for a rubber bath mat so we could safely use it.  Housekeeping was sub-par for a hotel of this caliber.  Dirty dishes were not always replaced, coffee was not always replenished and we found it odd that a housekeeping inspector needed to check the room following each cleaning.
Title: All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would more than likely refer Park Plaza Victoria to others.

Review: ¬†There was some confusion at breakfast.We pre-booked breakfast & planned to have the continental one but when we arrived at the restaurant,we decided to have the smoked salmon & scrambled egg & the poached egg on toast.Before ordering,I asked the waitress if we could still have a little something from the buffet & after asking a colleague,she said that we could have juice & a croissant but anything else would be extra.My partner had a glass of orange juice & I had apple juice,a croissant & a small bread roll.We paid ¬£11.98 when we left the restaurant but were surprised to get charged a further ¬£24.00 when we paid our bill & checked out.We explained that we hadn‚Äôt had the buffet breakfast  & that the waitress should have told us that we would get charged for both (the smoked salmon & poached eggs were only around ¬£7.50 each so I‚Äôm not quite sure how we got charged a total of ¬£36.00?
Title: The hotel is lovely & we had an excellent stay.Perfect location for Apollo Victoria theatre!

¬†There was a mix up at check in which I had to keep returning to reception to get it sorted.
It delayed getting into my room and I missed the start of my conference.

Review:
¬†I didnt like the room as it had an internal connecting door and the people in the adjoining room were so very noisy with TV left on at high volume. Can you improve the insulation between the internal connecting doors?
When I came to opening a minature gin from the mini bar, one of the 2 bottles of Bombay Sapphire was empty. This happens everywhere these days and fortunately the check out staff believed me. Suggest staff check mini bar to ensure this doesn't happen.
Title: I would stay again but not in a room with internal adjoining doors

Review:
¬†Entry to room where wardrobe is located is dark even with all the lights on.
Bathroom is also dark.
There are six mirrors in the room and not one of them is adequately lighted. Applying make-up is hit and miss.
Shower leaks badly. Floor is flooded after every shower.
Bathroom could do with an upgrade especially the tiles.
I stayed for 8 nights and not once did the front of house staff ever meet my eye or greet me as I came and went. It made me feel a little bit persona non grata.
Title: Good

Review:
¬†I  did  not  get  a  receipt when  I  left  the  Hotel,  although  on  18  September  2018  when  I  booked  at  "Special  requeste  "  was    mentioned: "This  guest  has  requested  a  receipt  for  their  stay. "
I  got  a  receipt  for  Booking.com--t.a.v.:Accounts  Payable     Herengracht  597  1017  CE  Amsterdam    Netherlands     Original  Tax  Invoice  .
At  the  hotel  the  staff  told  me  that  I  paid  for  booking.com  and  not  for  the  hotel--booking.com  it  means  for  the  Hotel  being  a  sort  of  Travel  Agency. 
 Today  my  bookkeeper  approved  the  Invoice  as   this  states   my  name too.  Why  you  did  not  tell  me  this  fact  ?
Title: excellent

Title: Good

Review:
¬†This time around I made up my mind to not stay at Park Plaza again. Over the past 2 years of staying at Park Plaza I've started to notice many little inconveniences and quality issues arise. Things like, missing battery covers on tv remotes, wifi that doesn't work in some rooms, a terrible odor coming from the bathroom, showers that flood bathroom floors, and a few other things.
The bathrooms are really starting to show their age. They look dingy and unfinished. The tile grout is gray from years of use. The bathroom looks like a high school gym locker room.  These a worn telephone next to the toilet in case you need to make a call while doing your business.
When I would take a shower, the 1/2 gap under the shower door would flood the floor. I would use all my clean towels to try and stop the River Nile from overflowing. (This is what made me decide I'm done booking rooms here.)
Title: Quality is sliding downward but a decent place to stay in Victoria.

Review:
¬†I specified a quiet room when booking and we got a room about 10 feet from the elevator so we could hear it every time it moved. A dull drone that was pretty annoying and went on pretty much the whole time. 
Also, we didn't know that the method of letting staff know that we didn't want our room cleaned early morning was using the electronic keypad on the wall, so on our first morning, having not pushed the appropriate button, someone came into our room at 0800 while we were still in bed.
But both of these are minor in the grand scheme. Overall it was a great hotel.
Title: Great hotel. Very much recommended.

Review:
¬†The tapas style food in the restaurant was unusual for a Italian restaurant. Sharing pasta dishes expensive, sometimes you just want a plate of good old fashioned pasta. Main courses expensive and not enough for a main course I had to order salad and a dessert!
Also checking in they took ¬£100 on top of my room price and my husband room taking ¬£200 in total on top of the booking price, I am still waiting for the ¬£200 to go back to my account. Just take credit card details then I am covered for any costs. This was my spending money and we extended our stay they were going to do the same for the new booking but I argued against this.
Title: Unusual times with COVID

Review:
¬†As above, the COVID breakfast wasn‚Äôt great. I booked the hotel because the breakfast looked good, when I got there I was told the veggie option was porridge which is insane. Issues with the coffee maker and it only filled my cup halfway. There was no toast or no option/offer to have toast which would have been nice for me as I only had an egg spinach and some hash browns. Bread is cheap!
There was orange juice but no apple juice and the orange juice was served in tiny glasses which were not full. My bedroom did not have a room service menu when I got in there and my bedroom bin was full so I had to get someone to empty it. My partner wanted a bath and there was mould all around the edges so didn‚Äôt have a bath. I also noticed the towels are tiny so it would be difficult to dry off anyway.
Title: Good

Review:
¬†We booked a superior queen room ,We have  stayed in many hotels all over the country and we have found rooms that are clearly for disabled people fall well below superior standard ,we did not like the hand rails and pull cords that were in our bathroom .
The bathroom is in need of modernising as the silicone is starting to mould and the shower head is very dated and rusting 
Accssecing the bath taps and plug was also a problem as the screen seemed to limit movement .
When we checked in we were told breakfast was limited due to the current Covid situation which we fully understood and we ordered our breakfast for the following morning to be delivered to our room at 9am.At 9.30 and after  numerous calls to reception with no answer  I went to the reception desk and was told by a very unsympathetic man who I think needs more customer service training  that there was no record of our breakfast being delivered .He handed me 2 bags of breakfast and said any problems come and see me ,no apology nothing .Our breakfast was freezing cold and we did not eat it and decided to check out and pay for breakfast elsewhere.We checked out with the same man and told him we would like the cost for our breakfast deducted from our bill and from what we could gather was trying to rip us off by not giving us our full money back and after a fuss it was given.
Whist we were checking out another receptionist was calling other rooms to let them know their breakfast was ready , we did not receive any calls and because of this it has clouded our stay and we will not be returning and will not recommend this hotel .
Title: Sub standard

When we checked in we were told breakfast was limited due to the current Covid situation which we fully understood and we ordered our breakfast for the following morning to be delivered to our room at 9am.At 9.30 and after  numerous calls to reception with no answer  I went to the reception desk and was told by a very unsympathetic man who I think needs more customer service training  that there was no record of our breakfast being delivered .He handed me 2 bags of breakfast and said any problems come and see me ,no apology nothing .Our breakfast was freezing cold and we did not eat it and decided to check out and pay for breakfast elsewhere.We checked out with the same man and told him we would like the cost for our breakfast deducted from our bill and from what we could gather was trying to rip us off by not giving us our full money back and after a fuss it was given.
Whist we were checking out another receptionist was calling other rooms to let them know their breakfast was ready , we did not receive any calls and because of this it has clouded our stay and we will not be returning and will not recommend this hotel .
Title: Sub standard

Review:
¬†We booked a superior queen room ,We have  stayed in many hotels all over the country and we have found rooms that are clearly for disabled people fall well below superior standard ,we did not like the hand rails and pull cords that were in our bathroom .
The bathroom is in need of modernising as the silicone is starting to mould and the shower head is very dated and rusting 
Accssecing the bath taps and plug was also a problem as the screen seemed to limit movement .
When we checked in we were told breakfast was limited due to the current Covid situation which we fully understood and we ordered our breakfast for the following morning to be delivered to our room at 9am.At 9.30 and after  numerous calls to reception with no answer  I went to the reception desk and was told by a very unsympathetic man who I think needs more customer service training  that there was no record of our breakfast being delivered .He handed me 2 bags of breakfast and said any problems come and see me ,no apology nothing .Our breakfast was freezing cold and we did not eat it and decided to check out and pay for breakfast elsewhere.We checked out with the same man and told him we would like the cost for our breakfast deducted from our bill and from what we could gather was trying to rip us off by not giving us our full money back and after a fuss it was given.

Review: ¬†Air conditioning wasn‚Äôt working properly and very hot during the night
Title: Good

Review:
¬†I was shocked to find that non-recyclable disposable cups are being used at breakfast. There were also ceramic cups on the tables, but only disposable ones next to the coffee/tea machine which meant many people (like I almost did) had incorrectly used these. I questioned the manager as she shrugged her shoulders and said "I know", blaming management's decision - so that people could take coffee's away if they wanted. In the time I was sat there I watched staff use these cups for their drinks, children use them as pen pots and many of them cleared into waste by breakfast staff - unbelievably wasteful and not eco-friendly. At the very least put a sign up or put the ceramic cups next to the coffee machines, or sell reuseable cups!!
Breakfast itself was very average and there was no gluten free/diary free sections.
Title: Good

Review:
¬†cooked breakfast was very poor quality. Bacon hard, too much butter in scrambled egg, very dry 
No porridge
Restaurant always near full
Tea awful as pre done in jugs for hours!
Only one receptionist at 0830 hrs so wait very long to check out. Concierge in the end offered to take my email address to bypass the long wait in the end. No management oversight of whether one receptionist was enough
Title: Good location, poor breakfast, Excellent dinner, rooms tired, sky good, room spacious

Review:
¬†1. Inconsistent service - some days ur room will be restocked with coffee and tea and toilet rolls and most other days you have to request each item. Even ur requests get miscommunicated along the way. Ask for water and coffee pods and get milk and sugar üò£
2. Room facilities were aged and broken. Light control panel faulty (lights switch off whenever). Extractor fan in bathroom works temporarily. Kettle button needs to be held down. Bar Fridge makes sounds throughout the night. I stayed in room 701. 
3. Breakfast room was closed and breakfast moved to lounge area without notice. Breakfast items (bottled water) inconsistently supplied. 
4. After complaining you get sent chocolates which really don‚Äôt help the fact that you paid for 2 rooms at a 4 star hotel in pounds for 10 days and received at best 3 star quality. 
5. We had at 11pm a fire alarm going off that woke us up. 
VERY POOR FOR A RADISSON HOTEL. I travel all around the world and frequently stay at the RADISSON - this was shocking.
Title: Most disappointing stay!

Review:
¬†Hotel rooms look pretty tired and small. We booked an executive room for three a month in advance which was not ready by the time of our arrival. We were ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù to some apartment on the 9th floor which had two little rooms - one a double bedroom and the other a short single bed in what looked like a kitchen! üôÑ The bathroom in the upgraded accommodation was much smaller than in the original executive room. 
Hair dryer was in the room and could not be used in the bathroom in front of the mirror!!! Useless!! Not enough breakfast space on sunday -  we were asked to come later, in 40 minutes!!‚Äô

Review:
¬†The rooms were not cleaned daily despite requesting cleaning service by the door signage. Looked like the hotel was understaffed. Was really surprised, that there was a 'Congratulations' message at the reception for the hotel group being selected for some award. 
PS. I have been staying here every time I come to London, for many years. 
Really disappointed!
Title: Disappointing

Review:
¬†The rooms were not cleaned daily despite requesting cleaning service by the door signage. Looked like the hotel was understaffed. Was really surprised, that there was a 'Congratulations' message at the reception for the hotel group being selected for some award. 
PS. I have been staying here every time I come to London, for many years. 
Really disappointed!
Title: Disappointing

Review:
¬†The room 552 is not to be sold separately as it is right next to another room 554 with the same problem. 
Both rooms have an interconnecting door in between, which is far from being sound-proof. 
We could hear tour neighbours and they could hear us, even the slightest sounds. 
Very uncomfortable experience, even for one night. No privacy at all. 
Please do not sell those rooms and similar ones to your guests unless you sell them together to families. 
Or else, if you sell one room do not sell the other for the same night.
Title: Perfect location, best hotel in Victoria if no interconnecting door in your room.

Review: ¬†Awful experience with a room service staff member ruined the experience of my stay. Also didn't like that the fridge in my room was not working, and that the waitress at the lounge by the reception were not very friendly. A hotel can be as beautiful as it can be, but at the end of the day, it is the staff that make or break the experience.
Title: A very disappointing experience

Review: ¬†The room was cold . No extra blanket.  I was given a disabled room so the shower was not nice.  I left my headphones charging and they would not go up and check for me to hand them back.
Title: Not up to standards for the price

Review: ¬†The room was cold . No extra blanket.  I was given a disabled room so the shower was not nice.  I left my headphones charging and they would not go up and check for me to hand them back.
Title: Not up to standards for the price

Review: ¬†The glass washbasin was badly damaged with a large crack right across it - very dangerous. The bathroom floor tiles were also very badly cracked and a health hazard for anyone walking barefoot as it could have caused a very nasty cut - avoiding this in the middle of the night was a safety hazard.
Title: Disappointing for such a high cost, do not intend to return.

Review:
¬†I had to change my room on check in. The room I was allocated backed onto a very busy street and the window was not soundproofed (maybe broken). Very loud in the room. Cleaner had also left a cleaning rag on my bed. Manager ated swiftly and change my room immrediately so no complaints re the service.
Only used the bar - which was spacious but very loud.
Title: Well located but average Central London hotel - fall back option when others aren't available.

Only used the bar - which was spacious but very loud.
Title: Well located but average Central London hotel - fall back option when others aren't available.

Review:
¬†The bathroom needed a better exhaust. It was impossible to stay in the bathroom after a shower, far too humid. I didn't like the shower over the bath, far too dangerous, & the screen was not wide enough to keep the floor dry.
I was sick with the flu during our 5 day stay, so we asked the male concierge for advice regarding nearest doctor & chemist. For the doctor he suggested that we go to one that would require a 15 minute cab drive & similar for the chemist. However, we found a doctor just 5 minutes walk away, & she dispensed the antibiotics herself! The concierge estimated that his recommended doctor would charge about 80 pounds, whereas the one we found charged just 60. This concierge was of no use at all.
Title: The hotel is not in a nice area of London, not in a tourist area at all.

Review: ¬†For the price I paid there were several faults. The air con was not working. I reported this, an engineer came did something but didn‚Äôt actually tell me if the problem was resolved. He left and the issue was still present. Reported it again and nothing was done - very poor customer service considering it‚Äôs one of the hottest weekends! Potentially could have moved me rooms?? In addition, room was right outside some building works now I appreciate this isn‚Äôt the hotel‚Äôs fault but had to keep the window shut as there was so much noise - even early this morning on a Saturday woke me up unecessarily early. With no air con and no windows open it became a real issue! Disappointed to say the least with the service received.
Title: Review of Stay 23/08/2019

Review: ¬†The systems do NOT work, neither the air conditioning in the one bedroom suite we had reserved (we were up all night since it was a 100 degree night & the windows were locked shut). Then the kettle in the downgraded room they gave us the next day disappeared after we left to go out to dinner!. Manager really tried to make up for it th next day, but best he could do was a lower level suite. Staff - manager and night personnel - tried hard to make us comfortable, but the systems and overall set up is really flawed.
Title: Okay

Review: ¬†I have stayed at this property before and that stay was spot on! Its a shame this experience did not measure up. I'd booked an 'Executive Studio' but failed to identify what made it 'executive'. On arrival the room had no information folder, room service menu and the desk area had a layer of dust on that would suggest that housekeeping had failed to engage with their dusters. I wouldn't rebook the studio as in my opinion the Rooms offer a better experience and are better value for money.
Title: Good location, but disappointing rooms/service

¬†1. No gluten free bread for room service. This bread is available for breakfast, but cannot understand how it is not available for the food for room service.
2. There were continuous bad smell in the bathroom.
3. Even when I paid a very high rate for the room, the rate did not include breakfast.
4. Inside noise isolation between bedrooms is not very good. I could hear my neighbors, maybe because we shared a door for eventual room connection.

Review: ¬†I booked and executive twin room for myself and my friend. I asked at reception what you got with the executive room and if there was an executive lounge. She said no there isn‚Äôt a lounge. However we noticed on the lift information board that there was a lounge? So went back and asked and she said oh yes there is an executive lounge but you don‚Äôt get access with an executive room???? You have to pay extra per head to use the lounge? Which I did, then was questioned in the lounge that we had only paid for one person? I did mention it when we checked out. But I don‚Äôt think it sunk in.
Title: Good

Review:
¬†Where do we start? The staff are reminiscent of Manuel from Fawlty Towers - although his command of English and perception of guest needs were superior. The fact that it is virtually impossible to find a staff-member whose first language is English means that much is lost in the translation (either deliberately or otherwise). Our one-bedroom apartment (almost 350 pounds a night) could have been good if re-furbished, but it was in an appalling state of disrepair, with cupboard doors and drawers chipped and mal-aligned, a non-working dishwasher, large gouges out of the wooden floor (and parts of it that had lifted off completely), doors that didn't shut properly, a pungent and sickening influx of onion and garlic cooking smells several times a day, tatty furniture, no table to eat at, missing and mis-matched cutlery - the list goes on! The advertised coffee pods were not replaced each day (until we asked), and our bathrobes were removed during cleaning on the second day and had to be retrieved. The housekeeping was perfunctory and erratic. An extra 12.5% was added to our room service bill (not mentioned in the menu) and the quality of the food was mediocre. We took friends to the hotel's breakfast on one morning, and it was embarrassing - tired quintessential English greasy (and cold) hot dishes (one slice or two of congealed scrambled eggs? - with slightly exotic dishes such as eggs benedict or espresso coffee an extra cost). We reported the non-working dishwasher and onion smells to housekeeping and were assured that "maintenance" would look at it, but nothing happened.
All of this might have been predictable and tolerable had we been paying a third of the tariff we were charged, but it was unacceptble for the price.
We are a Booking.
Title: Poor service and quality of accommodation

Our one-bedroom apartment (almost 350 pounds a night) could have been good if re-furbished, but it was in an appalling state of disrepair, with cupboard doors and drawers chipped and mal-aligned, a non-working dishwasher, large gouges out of the wooden floor (and parts of it that had lifted off completely), doors that didn't shut properly, a pungent and sickening influx of onion and garlic cooking smells several times a day, tatty furniture, no table to eat at, missing and mis-matched cutlery - the list goes on! The advertised coffee pods were not replaced each day (until we asked), and our bathrobes were removed during cleaning on the second day and had to be retrieved. The housekeeping was perfunctory and erratic. An extra 12.5% was added to our room service bill (not mentioned in the menu) and the quality of the food was mediocre. We took friends to the hotel's breakfast on one morning, and it was embarrassing - tired quintessential English greasy (and cold) hot dishes (one slice or two of congealed scrambled eggs? - with slightly exotic dishes such as eggs benedict or espresso coffee an extra cost). We reported the non-working dishwasher and onion smells to housekeeping and were assured that "maintenance" would look at it, but nothing happened.
All of this might have been predictable and tolerable had we been paying a third of the tariff we were charged, but it was unacceptble for the price.
We are a Booking.
Title: Poor service and quality of accommodation

Review: ¬†Getting back late and being challenged by the security. No explanation just 'Are you staying here' in quite a direct manner as if we were just popping in from the street. Ordered a drink at the bar only to be confronted abruptly with 'I need your room key card' only when asked why did we find out that the bar was only serving guests at that time. It takes only a little longer to explain why you might be asking the questions rather than making your guests feel quite uncomfortable.

Review: ¬†Check in was laborious - the two guys on the desk seemed to find it amusing to keep me waiting until they'd dealt with 'their issue'. There was no one else checking in and from what I could see, they weren't dealing with anything at all - just reveling in the fact they were keeping me waiting. 'Wait over there - we're busy with somethin' was the abrupt order. Not what I was expecting after flying back from Sydney. I was then advised I needed to come back down to reception before 2pm the next day to ensure I could keep my room for the 2nd night - even though I'd paid 2 nights in advance.  When I went to reception the staff member couldn't work out why I'd come to see them. I then asked for a 2nd room key as the one I had kept faulting and I didn't want to take the lift 9 floors to reception each time my door wouldn't open. The guy on the desk looked completely confused. Why is that so odd? The apartment needs redecorating - it looks tired and the air-con doesn't work in the lounge so it was very hot.  When I called reception I was advised 'just turn it down' - go figure! I have stayed in a lot of PP hotels and this is the worst with regards staff.  I booked an apartment thinking Id get a great place to relax and nice staff.
Title: Great location - shame about the staff

Review: ¬†Breakfast was poor, the restaurant area is overcrowded, only one chef actually cooking with a default excuse of comeback in 10 mins for cooked food, we waited 30 mins !, we also had to wait outside the restaurant as it was full, however staff dont come and get you when a table is free, so people who arrived after you are seated before you !, we actually gave up on breakfast the first day because of this and had to go into town to get fed because of the service, the second day we tried and ended up taking over an hour to get seated, fed and back to the room.
Title: nice room, poor breakfast

Review: ¬†Our room had an adjoining door and was really noisy. We asked to move in the middle of the night as next door‚Äôs television kept us awake. We were moved to another room which was slightly better for the noise; still had an adjoining door though (and we had asked for one without) and we could clearly hear people next door talking. Room was also not as nice, smaller size and bed. The hotel gave us breakfast for free to make up for the inconvenience, which was nice.

Review:
¬†The front desk staff are very slow, unable to address basic inquiries and lack proper service orientation. 
Mattresses are too soft lacking good back support.
Had to change to a smaller room (with the same rate) to avoid continuous plumbing noises.
Rooms remained hot for 3 nights despite changing the AC settings. 
Ongoing maintenance work in the lobby made it small and crowded.
Title: I don't think I'd stay there again

Review:
¬†Check in was a long difficult process. Booked well ahead. E mails and telephone. To ensure a smooth check in as sister and I having a one night stay as respite from care of ailing father. 
Conversations  by phone were denied and all promises broken. Paid even more.to have an apt on top floor as hotel chosed for view . 3 staff were helpful. The one just repeated that no notes had been written from my long phone call and nothing could br done. E mails from Booking .com had said the hotel had replied and agreed to early checkin and late checkout. Apparently sent in error. No early checkin and paid for extra hr.
Title: Disappointing. Saved by London being so lovely. Some nice members of staff

Review:
¬†1: Room was not ready at the check in time
2: The executive room was a lot smaller than any park plaza room I have stayed in previously 
3: I could not get to the other side of the room without banging into the desk, which was far too large for the size of the room
4: Control panel on one side of the bed was not working 
5: The advertised slippers and bathrobe were not present in the room
6: I was expecting 2 chairs in an executive room for 2, but only 1 was present
I spoke to reception about my disappointment, and was told that the room size was correct, and when I asked for an alternate I was told that there were no other rooms available, but she would get maintenance and housekeeping to address my concerns.
After then coming back from an evening out to find  none of the above issues to be resolved and no explanation or apology given I was left annoyed.
After coming back to the hotel the next evening to still be in the same situation, my patients finally broke and brought the manager up to the room to show him my concerns.
I was told that the room size was to their executive standard, but he was concerned that the other issues had not been addressed. 
Now bearing in mind that I was checking out the next morning, I was offered:
1: A change of room which I declined
2: The bathrobe and slippers were then sent up
3: A bottle of wine for the inconvenience 
4: Extra points added to my Radisson account 
50th Birthday Celebration in a nice hotel already ruined.
Jumped in the shower to finally settle down for the evening to find the flannels had been taken and not replaced.
And then just to cap it off just before check out,
Empty condom and viagra packets were found behind the television cabinet.
I have stayed in Park Plaza hotels all over the world and this is the 1st time I have given a poor review..... and never one this long
Title: Disappointing

Review:
¬†We booked our room via booking.com, and we chose the option to pay in Euro. On check-in day, they did not get the money, but on the check-out day, and it was 14 Euros more ( apparently due to the exchange rate, happened in only two days!!!). Their logic was that "it is how it works" !!: To charge the customers on the check-out day! Nonsense! As if they have the only hotel in the world and people have not seen other hotels before. 
The price in Pounds, however, was the same, but the important point was that we chose the option of Euro, for a certain amount,  and just that certain amount, not more. People call it a "deal". Apparently they do not care about this term in this hotel with their payment policy!
Furthermore,  they booked 50 pounds from our credit card for the stuff in the mini bar,  that's okay, but then put something in it too!
The room was clean and with a very nice view, but was behind the lift, which was going up and down all night long. It Was pretty hard to sleep there.
All in all, was an annoying experience.
Title: Fair

Review:
¬†The cleaning of the room. The cleaning lady took away things that she shouldn't, such as a sponge to put on foundation. Furthermore one day we didn't get a refill of coffee, nor a new shower cap. Three other days we had less towels. The toilet kept on running all night... I traveled to about 85 countries, but this service was under par.
 In general I don't complain about cleaning or housekeeping staff, since they are rather poorly paid, but in this case I'm afraid I have to.
Title: We survived...

Review:
¬†1. Super cold room. No way to heat it up. 1 degree outside, equals 15 degrees inside. The AC on max on 28 degrees still blew cold air in. Nightmare- got a cold
2. Housekeeping threw out some of my small belongings. Did not refill toiletries or teas even though we nad almost none(made teas cause it was so cold in the room)
3. There was an incident with unruly guest who was running around the corridors. Knocking on doors, pretending to be police and screaming to open up. It was around 1:00 and 2:00 am. Took a while for the hotel to react, had to call reception. Got woken up by him and was pretty frightened.
Overall a poor overall feel of a nice looking hotel. Stayed in a ‚Äôsuperior‚Äô room but would have to pay extra to upgrade and get bottled water in the room!

3. There was an incident with unruly guest who was running around the corridors. Knocking on doors, pretending to be police and screaming to open up. It was around 1:00 and 2:00 am. Took a while for the hotel to react, had to call reception. Got woken up by him and was pretty frightened.
Overall a poor overall feel of a nice looking hotel. Stayed in a ‚Äôsuperior‚Äô room but would have to pay extra to upgrade and get bottled water in the room!
Title: Poor

Review: ¬†At 5pm I reported to the desk that I had no biscuits in my room and fancied a cup of coffee with a biscuit before I went out to work. At 6pm no biscuits so I phoned again and awas promised biscuits. At 7pm no biscuits so I phoned again and was told I needed to phone room service for biscuits!!! I asked why I wasn't told this before and the reply was I thought that was obvious!! I then phoned room service and luckily spoke with PK who was genuinely apologetic and within 5 minutes he brought me a plate of biscuits. I strongly recommend PK is upgraded to staff trainer as he seems to be the only member of staff that can appreciate the situation from a client's viewpoint!!
Title: Staff need to be trained to be more positive towards clients!

Review: ¬†My friend booked the room from 16.-19. November. The first night was paid in advance, so we only had to pay for 2 nights. When we came to hotel, we wanted to pay straight away, but the receptionist refused. He asked for a credit card for pre-authorization and we wanted to give the one we already paid the first night with, but he didn't want to take it. He insisted on another one instead. I gave him mine and asked what will he do with it and he said he won't take any money from it, it is only the guarantee we will pay for our stay. Next, I checked my bank account and it showed that the hotel took amount of money for 2 nights (including the deposit). I complained to another receptionist and she said the money isn't taken but "frozen".  Next thing, my friend's father informed her that the hotel called him on his phone and asked if he wants to pay for the rest 2 nights with that same card (the one we used for first night and the one they didn't want to take for pre-authorization) and he refused, because he knew they already have frozen our money. On Sunday we went to inform the reception about this behaviour and that we are shocked that you have guests in your hotel willing to pay, and you refuse it and then call someone who isn't there at all to pay. We explained everything all over again to another receptionist, and she apologized and asked if we want to pay now and I agreed. They said they will make the payment from frozen amount of money, but they took ANOTHER amount of money from my card which means I paid DOUBLE. I complained again to the chief desk officer and she said she will talk to accountant first thing on Monday to release the money and it will be in 3-5 working days back. TWO WEEKS passed already and my money is still missing. This can be treated as stealing. I have to say I‚Äôm truly outraged and shocked with this way of working and I travel a lot and stay in very good hotels.
Title: Very disappointing and unpleasent

¬†charged twice for room, hotel took ages to refund money.
Also charged twice for room service. Ordered hot chocolate which took ages to arrive, when it did it was cold in a weird jug. Paid for with cash and had wait ages for change. This was not recorded so was charged again. Not investigated when I reported it to reception staff.
Breakfast room too small, had to wait to be seated, tables to close to each other. Cooked food not very hot.

Review: ¬†The hotel was chosen because of the accessibility to the train stations. Probably because of this in the lobby was a sense of a courtyard. Endless movement of guests and others... hall is not cozy. The room was provided with one double bed. But the reminder that you have booked a room with two single beds moved. The room is quiet relative to the corridor. But between the rooms the audibility is very good. An hour and a half before 1 am could not sleep because of conversations in the next room. Breakfast is sufficient. But where is the famous oatmeal? At 9 o'clock to find a table was problematic. A lot of hustle and bustle as wanting to eat, and staff. We are glad that we stayed only for one night!
Title: I can recommend this hotel, but it is desirable to change some points.

Review: ¬†Nobody mentioned at reception that we needed to leave a credit card swipe in order to have access to the minibar. I arrived after a long journey, exhausted and dehydrated - I just wanted a bottle of water!  No complementary bottle as in most hotels and the mini bar was locked for heavens sake. I stay at hotels all over the world very regularly and this is a first. Made a smartish hotel feel like a hostel.  Also had to call technical services to get internet access in our room.
Title: Very convenient for Victoria, comfortable but services below par.

Review:
¬†Really disappointed with this stay, this would have been the Hotel of choice to stay in London when flying to Gatwick. Few issues with room (wont go into them as they are not the reason for the poor review) which where minor. The real issue was, despite reporting the issues 3 times, they where not dealt with.
This appeared to me to be a staff problem more than an hotel problem.
The follow up resolution was excellent and what we would have expected.
I have taken a couple of weeks to reflect as sometimes spontaneous reviews are never a true reflection of a stay and it is important to point out the positives, breakfast as usual excellent, reception staff very good and follow up to problems was excellent.
We are allowed a slip on standards, but is how they are resolved that is a truer reflection of an establishment.
Title: Dissappointed to leave a bad review

Review: ¬†There were two single beds pushed together. Cabling untidy and occupies the only bedside plug sockets. No side lamps or dim light at night, full/mood/reading lights all quite disturbing to your partner when triggered. Sink in the bathroom lacks seal on plug . After winding the plug fully in water still pours down the drain and no water retained. A bit challenging when you want a shave. Shower control is trial and error and comes off in your hand. No symbols for shower/bath/hand shower.
Title: Okay

After winding the plug fully in water still pours down the drain and no water retained. A bit challenging when you want a shave. Shower control is trial and error and comes off in your hand. No symbols for shower/bath/hand shower.
Title: Okay

Review: ¬†Constant wifi problems. Slow wifi. This is a basic service. I got faster wifi in hotels costing 1/3 as much. Fix this
Title: Very poor wifi. Avoid the hotel.

Review: ¬†Constant wifi problems. Slow wifi. This is a basic service. I got faster wifi in hotels costing 1/3 as much. Fix this
Title: Very poor wifi. Avoid the hotel.

Review: ¬†Very poor WiFi
Title: Pleasant

Review: ¬†There was building work when I visit and it was in a state of barely controlled chaos. The check in staff where either phased by the relocated check in desk or just grumpy, certainly it wasn't the friendliest welcome. Check out seemed to be equally problematic. Wifi was none existent in my room, which is just unacceptable in this day and age
Title: Can be better, disappointed this time

Review:
¬†Renovations were quite disruptive and noisey.
House keeping towel delivery inconsistent.
Title: Good

Review:
¬†Housekeeping was bizarre. We had to call every single day for facecloths and coffee pods. We actually had one of the bosses come to the room and explained to her that we really did not want to call housekeeping every day. She promised to take care of everything. Fail! Had to call again the next day. Service in the hotel restaurant was unbelievably bad. We had the rudest server in London. 
The hotel is in the midst of a renovation which leads to some disorder. What was not expected was the filthiness just outside the doors of the hotel. They have no brooms?
We travel all over the world and this experience was unusual.
Title: Good location, but too many issues

Review:
¬†Sound proof is 0. We could actually hear every word people said in the next room. It is like we lived in a tent, not in 4-star London hotel. We've lived in 2 different rooms during our stay and both were the same.
The rooms were dirty when we arrived, both of them. One had hair all over bathroom and the other - water on the floor. So we had to move to the other two rooms on the second floor, without any view from the window - just air conditioners.
Title: In most cases does not worth the money.

Review: ¬†We would stay here again because of the location, but the hotel could be even better if only there were more attention to some details. We stayed in a spacious one bedroom suite, with self-catering facilities. However, the carpets were filthy and torn/threadbare, the wooden floor in the lounge area was heavily damaged, the dishwasher didn't work (and wasn't fixed in the four days we stayed after reporting this) some light globes needed replacing, the furniture was very knocked about and internal doors were heavy to open and shut. The blind for the bathroom window was broken and the washbasin sprayed water in all directions (again, not attended to even though we had asked for it to be fixed). We needed to ask for sugar sachets (twice). Staff were friendly, but for most English was clearly their second language, and we suspect that some things just got lost in translation. What could have been an exceptional hotel (it has all the basics) was a little Fawlty Tower-ish in some aspects. The good outweighed the bad and we were in relaxed holiday mode, so we just laughed off these things, but it was sad that things could obviously have been much better with comparatively little needed to achieve that.
Title: Great location and fundamentally good, but some shortcomings

Review:
¬†Data- August 24-28th 2018 family books two rooms at London Victoria Park Plaza.
Problems;
1) Hotel under construction/refurbishment but this is not relayed on website.
2) Unpleasant smell on entering hotel, checkin-reception area and lobby. Most similar to urine.
3) Requested adjoining rooms- unavailable.
4)Rotten sandwich in minibar, with foul smell.
5)Moved to another room, which was " ....ready." with nonfunctioning minibar, no kettle, missing pillows.
6) Moved to "executive room". Same size as other rooms if not smaller, but executive because of coffee machine robe and slippers. Rusty faucet.
7) Do not disturb indicator on door, but room was entered and items were missing.
8) Cost to stay at hotel is misleading and implies high standards and quality.
9) After seeing four rooms at the establishment, the conclusion is:
There is no standard of room set-up,  cleanliness is lacking. Implying that proper inspection is not taking place.
Housekeeping Staff and room service work in disconnect and see no reason to excel at their job, because of lack of incentive.
The staff at reception are disgruntled, and give the impression that guests are a bother.
Solution - Close for renovations and train staff in customer service.
Title: Not good.

Review:
¬†We have stayed here a number of times in the last 3/4 years. We
always have two rooms sometimes up to four rooms at a time. It‚Äôs very
central and convenient for everything. However last time we stayed
earlier this year we felt things in the hotel were looking a little
shabby and tired, we noticed a difference of amenities in each of the
rooms even though two were supposed to be the same. This time we have
had four rooms three the same and one different type, again totally
different amenities, simple things like slippers in some but not all, no
ironing board in one but it had an iron, no face clothes in any
something there has always been in the past. Lack of loo roll, lack of
clean towels. We were asked when we checked in how many days we would
not like housekeeping, as we were there for five nights we agreed only
one, we were given a voucher worth ¬£10 per room for money off our lounge
bar bill in exchange for no housekeeping. We in fact only had our rooms
cleaned twice and that was after we called reception to report there had
been no housekeeping done! As for the voucher you would think that would
be straight forward but no we only ended up have ¬£2 removed from our bar
bill, (this was rectified at reception when we checked out!) I
appreciate Work needs to be carried out at some point but out of the
five days only once did all four lifts work usually only two, surly
August is a busy month to be doing such work and the reception desk was
blocked off with a small temporary one being used. We felt things on the
whole have slipped a lot on this trip, which is a great same as we have
always enjoyed our stays here.
Title: Fair

been no housekeeping done! As for the voucher you would think that would
be straight forward but no we only ended up have ¬£2 removed from our bar
bill, (this was rectified at reception when we checked out!) I
appreciate Work needs to be carried out at some point but out of the
five days only once did all four lifts work usually only two, surly
August is a busy month to be doing such work and the reception desk was
blocked off with a small temporary one being used. We felt things on the
whole have slipped a lot on this trip, which is a great same as we have
always enjoyed our stays here.
Title: Fair

Review: ¬†I didn't like being given a room that already had guest in. Also went to breakfast and whilst there the maids had stripped and began clearing the room for the next guest this was at 9.30 when check out states 12.00pm very poor service

Review:
¬†Dirty glass in room at arrival and post cleaning next day left it in the room on drinks tray as if ready to.use - still with milk dried in it.
Tv didnt work and was a hassle arranging for it to be fixed (twice).
Not enough lifts for size of hotel.
Receptionist not particularly pleasant.
Not really standard expected for cost.

Review:
¬†There were a lot of minor flaws, which summed up to an overall disappointment. The rooms were said to be ready by 2.00 Pm, we arrived at 3:30 and the larger room was still not done. It took more than an additional hour before we were let into the room. The large room (I think it was called junior suite) was an annex on the roof and had two sides of windows and a flat roof. That caused the room to heat up quickly, during the hot days in this year's August the air conditioning could not cope with that. The cleaning staff opened the blinds every day so that the room heated up all day.
The bathroom needs renovation, the mirrors show large areas of rust. The shower cabin was severely leaking so the bathroom was flooded after each shower. 
There were no spots to hang the towels. There was no power outlet near a mirror, so using a blow dryer was kind of impossible. 
When opening the room door, the light in the bathroom was lit. It could only be switched off from a panel next to the bed - that means there was no way to discretely leave the room when one person woke up earlier, without waking the others up.
None of these flaws were major, but all in all our stay did not match the aspiration level of a park plaza hotel - nor did it match the paid price.
Title: Excellent location, but does not live up to the aspiration level

Review:
¬†The food was absolutely disgusting! 
The cleaners knocked 3 times in the morning asking what time did we check out from 10:30 this happened when check out is at 12!
It was meant to be a chilled morning as we have young kids we wanted to make the most of the time to ourselves.! This was extremely annoying!!!
Also the lift for the car park was a joke just waiting for ages for them to open.
And then when you get to the car park downstairs it's like a car boot sale.
I've been to park plazas lots of times & they've been great but this one put them to shame. Worst experience ever.
Title: It was awful not much more to say

Review: ¬†No teaspoons despite asking twice, only one socket for iron and hairdryer and nowhere near a mirror for drying hair
Title: Nice hotel

Review: ¬†The location was the only good thing about this hotel. But here are some bad things that I have experienced during my stay at this hotel. First night: I was in a room on the third floor. The room and furniture were literally shaking and about to collapse whenever the door in the next room was opened and closed, like an earthquake. I asked them to change it and they did, and believe or not, they said it‚Äôs so common in their hotel to hear from residents about the doors problem. Second issue: After three nights, I decided to extend my stay due to a flight change, so the hotel pre-charged my credit card 5 times during my stay!! (Before the check out time!) totally charged me for more than a double of the whole total amount of the stay. When I complained and met the duty manager, he said there is an error in the system !! And to be honest he didn‚Äôt say the truth cuz these transactions are done manually. I asked them to hold the whole amount for the stay just once, and release the rest of holding money that they hold without any reason or right! He said apologized about what happened and said okay but he didn‚Äôt know when these amount supposed to get back to my card, therefore, I was so limited financially on my card until the time of writing this comments. Third issue, with the bed: the cover sheet and pillows‚Äô sheets smell bad, they smell like a forgotten wet towel on the couch for days without getting it dried. I asked them to change them all, the did in the next day!! Third issue: they don‚Äôt put a new bag and form for the laundry again in the closet it you already used them. So you have to call every time to ask them to bring a bad & form to put in the closet in order to use them next time. Honestly, this is NOT a good hotel to stay at when you come to London whether for a vacation or business trip!
Title: Fair
